name: Bench Press
instructions: Lie down on a flat bench. Grab the barbell with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Lift the barbell from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This is your starting position.
Breathe in and bring the barbell down slowly until it's about chest level.
Push the barbell back up to the starting position as you breathe out. Focus on using your chest muscles.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name: Push-up
instructions: Get on all fours, placing your hands slightly wider than your shoulders.
Straighten your arms and legs to lift your body. Your body should form a straight line from your head to your heels.
Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor.
Push yourself back up to the starting position.
Repeat.

name: Deadlift
instructions: Stand with your mid-foot under the barbell.
Bend over and grab the bar with a shoulder-width grip.
Bend your knees until your shins touch the bar.
Lift your chest up and straighten your lower back.
Take a big breath, hold it, and stand up with the weight. Keep the bar in contact with your legs.
Return the weight to the floor by moving your hips back and bending your legs.

name: Pull-up
instructions: Grab the pull-up bar with your palms facing away from you and your hands shoulder-width apart.
Hang with your arms fully extended.
Pull yourself up until your chin is above the bar. Avoid swinging your legs.
Lower yourself back down to the starting position with control.
Repeat.

name: Squat
instructions: Stand with your feet slightly wider than your hips.
Keep your chest up and engage your core as you push your hips back and bend your knees as if you're sitting in a chair.
Lower down until your thighs are parallel to the floor, or as low as you can comfortably go.
Push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Repeat.

name: Leg Press
instructions: Sit on the leg press machine with your back and head resting comfortably against the padded support.
Place your feet on the footplate about hip-width apart.
Your legs should form an angle of about 90 degrees at the knees.
Push the platform away with your heels and forefoot. Do not lock your knees at the top.
Slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat.

name: Tricep Dips
instructions: Sit on the edge of a bench or chair, with your hands gripping the edge, shoulder-width apart.
Slide your butt off the front of the bench with your legs extended out in front of you.
Straighten your arms, keeping a little bend in your elbows to keep tension on your triceps and off your elbow joints.
Slowly bend your elbows to lower your body toward the floor until your elbows are at about a 90-degree angle.
Once you reach the bottom of the movement, press down into the bench to straighten your elbows, returning to the starting position.
Repeat.

name: Bicep Curls
instructions: Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length.
Keep your elbows close to your torso and rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward.
While keeping the upper arms stationary
Continue to raise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level.
Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.

name: Hammer Curls
instructions: Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length.
Hold the dumbbells with a neutral grip (palms facing in).
Keep your elbows close to your torso.
While keeping the upper arms stationary
Hold the top position for a moment, squeezing your biceps.
Inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.

name: Wrist Curls
instructions: Sit on a bench and hold a dumbbell in one hand.
Rest your forearm on your thigh, with your wrist and the dumbbell hanging off your knee.
Your palm should be facing up.
Slowly curl your wrist upwards, lifting the dumbbell as high as you can.
Hold for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch arms.

name: Overhead Press
instructions: Sit on a bench with back support or stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, with your palms facing forward and your elbows bent.
Exhale and press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended. Don't lock your elbows.
Hold for a moment at the top.
Inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat.

name: Lateral Raises
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
Keep your back straight and your arms almost fully extended.
Raise your arms out to the sides until they are at shoulder level. Keep a slight bend in your elbows.
Hold for a moment at the top.
Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat.

name: Crunches
instructions: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
Place your hands behind your head or across your chest.
Lift your head and shoulders off the floor, engaging your abdominal muscles.
Hold for a moment, then slowly lower yourself back down.
Repeat.

name: Plank
instructions: Start in a push-up position, but with your weight resting on your forearms instead of your hands.
Your body should form a straight line from your shoulders to your ankles.
Engage your core by sucking your belly button into your spine.
Hold this position for the desired amount of time.
